page.title: 14 CURRY'S POINT
page.content: Curry's Point is a headland to the north of Whitley Bay.Off Curry's Point is St.Mary's Island upon which stands the lighthouse.The headland is composed of sandstone and coal seams of the carboniferous period,upon which lies boulder clay deposited by the last ice age. To the north of Curry's Point the land is being eroded away at a fast rate.To the south of Curry's Point a sea wall has been built to protect the soft rocks. Curry's Point is so called after Michael Curry who was executed there on the fourth of September 1739 for murdering the landlord of "THE THREE HORSE SHOES",at Heartley ie. Robert Shevil.Curry was sentenced at Newcastle to hang here so he could see the scene of his crime.It was suspected that Shevil's wife aided Curry,but Curry denied it.
